transcripts.text: Today is Joseph Smith's birthday.  And while we do not have all of the time to dedicate to his birthday, we did want to dedicate just a little bit.  So for the occasion, we asked everybody to send in their testimonials of why they know Joseph Smith is the prophet.  And we chose one to air on the stream today for everyone.  That lucky winner is Walt Chidester.  He is going to be calling in any minute now with his testimony of why Joseph Smith is the prophet.  While we wait for his call, maybe Okay, Carson here.

While we're waiting for the call, sorry, we're a little bit frazzled.  Frazzle dazzle, everyone.  So anyway, yeah, so Joseph Smith, it's his birthday today.  And like Brett was saying, we did want to dedicate a little bit of time to honor the prophet's birthday.  And like Brett said, we did send out an email and we got many submissions, people sending in their testimony of the prophet.  And there was one person who really stood out.  They wrote a really, really long testimony.
I read it.
I don't think Brett did.  Did you, Brett?
I took a glance at it.  I skimmed over it.

But anyway, he should be calling in any minute now via Skype.  But anyway, while we're here, I just want to go ahead and maybe bear my testimony a little bit while we're waiting for Walt.  I hope everyone can hear me.  But I didn't always know that Joseph Smith was a prophet.  I... always wanted to know and always wanted to seek that knowledge because if I didn't know that it would be very difficult for me to know anything else about the church and it being true.  So I searched the scriptures and I prayed with all my might and When I was reading the Book of Mormon, you know, I'd read it many times, but one time I was reading it and I got an overwhelming feeling that this is a true book.  This is scripture that is meant for our time.  And I got a testimony of the Book of Mormon and I realized that because I had that testimony, it didn't matter at all.  if I knew that Joseph Smith was the prophet at that point, I knew the Book of Mormon was true.  And if the Book of Mormon is true, then Joseph Smith was certainly a prophet of God.  And I know that many of our viewers have sent in their testimonies, and I wish that we had time to have everyone talk about it.  But once again... We have a big, giant program for everyone.  Going to be starting at 7 o'clock Mountain Standard Time.  And I hope everyone is pumped for Christmas and for our Christmas show.  Anything to say, Brett?

Well, we've spent a lot of time working this week to put together such a great show and you know, it was a busy week for all of us and I'm sure for all of you guys as well because Christmas is coming up, we have a lot of family, family's coming into town,
and

you're doing a lot of maybe Christmas shopping for little ones, and just making sure that everything is going smoothly in the holidays.  My father, he always used to cook up a... Well, the prophet Joseph Smith, of course, because of him, we know that the Savior was born on April 6th.  It wasn't December 25th at all.  It was April 6th.  So what we really should be celebrating this time of year is the birth of the prophet Joseph Smith.

Well, wonderful.  I think that that is definitely something that we need to not gloss over and forget.  Joseph Smith is an extremely important individual in all of our lives, and I agree.  But go ahead, caller.
